info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 12:35PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garfield...northwestern Kane and southeastern Iron Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1235 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Panguitch Lake, or 27 miles east of Cedar City, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Panguitch, Hatch, Panguitch Lake, Bryce Canyon National Park, Hillsdale and Long Valley Junction. This includes the following highways... US Route 89 between mile markers 103 and 134. Utah Route 12 between mile markers 0 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
